decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from 03 February 2021
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Ex-01 (site plan/location plan);

PL-205 (proposed flank elevation); PL-202 (proposed street, front & rear elevations); PL-200 (proposed ground floor & first floor); EX-02 (Existing Basement Ground & First Floor Plans); EX-03 (Existing Second Third & Roof Floor Plans); EX-04 (Existing Front Rear & Side Elevations); EX-05 (Existing Sections); PL-201 (Proposed Second Third & Roof Floor Plans); PL-203 - Proposed Sections AA & BB, PL-204 - Proposed Section CC, Design & Access Statement prepared by PAD Architects LLP (dated 04/03/2020)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021). | Cycle parking for 9 no. bicycles shall be implemented in a secure and lockable compound, prior to first occupation and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2 | The development shall achieve compliance with the minimum acoustic standards for internal noise transmission and external noise (including existing plant).

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan(2021); Ealing SPG10 (Noise and Vibration) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | With regards to the basement extension, the development shall adhere to the details approved under the application ref: 194998CND dated 04/02/2020. This sets out details of control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800- 1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1(e) (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2026), policy LV 7.A, of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding any annotations on the approved drawings, all roof terraces in the development hereby approved, shall include obscure glazing with a minimum height of 1.8m to all sides with the exception of the rear facing side. Any side facing windows at first floor, second floor or roof level shall also be obscure glazed non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | With the exception of the roof terraces hereby approved; no other parts of the roof of the approved extensions shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to add  a bay window in the flank wall of flat 3 in pursuant to planning permission reference 200989FUL dated 03/02/2021 for 'Conversion of existing dwellinghouse into five self-contained residential units (1x studio, 1x 1-bed, 2x 2-bed and 1x 3-bed); lower ground floor basement extension with front and rear lightwells; part single, part two storey rear extension; formation of rear glazed roof terraces at first, second and roof levels; side and rear roof extensions; installation of two rooflights to front roofslope and associated external alterations with provision of amenity space, cycle parking and refuse storage'
